p: Once nucleocapsids and other virion structural components have been generated, they are carried by endogenous transport pathways to the inner surface of the cell membrane, where assembly and release of viral particles takes place. Efforts to develop specific inhibitors of this process are under way, but no drugs have yet been shown to have protective activity in vivo ( Harty, 2009). Because the same transport pathways are shared by uninfected cells, it is unlikely that drugs that block such mechanisms could be used as pathogen-specific tracer molecules.
